column4: My cron job isn't running? crontab -l has: */10 * * * * /home/bin/[mybinaryhere].sh > /dev/null   It's been 10 minutes with no run? Is there a way to echo when the next cron job will run?

My cron job isn't running? crontab -l has: */10 * * * * /home/bin/[mybinaryhere].sh > /dev/null   It's been 10 minutes with no run? Is there a way to echo when the next cron job will run? I followed https://help.ubuntu.com/community/CronHowto
creates a zip file and moves it to a different folder
Does the following: cd, zip -ur, mv.
I used ~ in a spot. Uhoh, that might be it.
Would that have been my issue? Using ~ for /home/user ?
Is there a way to force current cron jobs to run now, or at least see when they will run? Is it based on $date?
Is there a way to force current cron jobs to run now, or at least see when they will run? Is it based on $date? I still think it's failing.
you can only force cronjobs from /etc/cron.daily (weekly, hourly....)
I know what the exit code should be I just needed to know how to check it in a bash script.
if [ $? = 0 ]  then do something else do something different fi
